parameters.name: credential_id
parameters.description: The ID of the API client credential to rotate secrets for

role.description: The name of the role for this binding, formatted as either "roles/<name>" or "accounts/<id>/roles/<name>".

members.description: The members assigned to the roles in this binding, formatted as "user:<name>".

PolicyBinding.description: An assignment of members to roles

bindings.description: Bindings to assign members to roles

version.description:
The current update number used to ensure updates happen to the expected version.

On first update this must be 0 and on each successive update this must be the last known version. When getting or as the result of a set, this will be the current version.

createdAt.description:
When this policy was created.

Always present on get, ignored on set.

updatedAt.description:
When this policy was last updated.

Could be absent on get if not updated since initial creation. Ignored on set.

iamPolicy.description: A policy on a StackPath resource

parentId.description: The ID of an account that a StackPath account may belong to

rootUserId.description: The ID of a StackPath account's primary user

createdAt.description: The date a StackPath account was created

updatedAt.description: The date a StackPath account was last updated

identityAccount.description:
A StackPath account

An account is the top-most entity in the StackPath ecosystem. Accounts are associated with users and stacks (which in turn are associated with purchased products and services).

provider.description: The name of the identity provider powering an account link

remoteId.description: A StackPath account's foreign key at an identity provider

accountId.description: The ID of the StackPath account linked to an identify provider

identityAccountLink.description: A relationship between a StackPath account and their identity providers

name.description: The name of the new API credentials

id.description: The new API credential's unique identifier

clientId.description: The new API credential's OAuth2 client ID

clientSecret.description:
The new API credential's OAuth2 client secret

The client secret is returned only once and is not stored by StackPath. Please take care to save this response.

identityCreateUserCredentialResponse.description: A response from a request to create new user API credentials

email.description:
The user's email address

The user will use this as their login name at the StackPath customer portal

authorizedApplications.description:
A set of application slugs the user should have access to

If no application slugs are applied then the user will have access to the StackPath customer portal and API by default.

identityCreateUserResponse.description: A response from a request to create a new StackPath user

grant_type.description:
The OAuth2 grant type

Currently, only the "client_credentials" grant type is supported.

client_id.description: The client ID from your API credential

client_secret.description:
The client secret from your API credential

For security reasons, client secrets are not stored in StackPath's internal systems after they are generated. Please record your API client secret after generating it.

access_token.description: The access token to be provided as a Bearer token in the Authorization header to API calls

token_type.description:
The token's type

Currently, only bearer tokens are supported

expires_in.description: The token's expiration time, measured in seconds

identityGetAccessTokenResponse.description:
A response from a request to generate an OAuth2 access token from API credentials

Use the resulting token to authorize subsequest StackPath API calls

identityGetAccountResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a StackPath account

identityGetAccountUsersResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a StackPath account's users

accountId.description: The ID of the StackPath account the policy is on

identityGetIAMPolicyResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a StackPath account's policy

identityGetUserCredentialsResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a user's API credentials

identityGetUserResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a StackPath user account

identityProvider.description:
An identity provider

Identity providers handle user authentication to the StackPath customer portal. They can be third party like Google or Facebook, or StackPath can provide identity resources for users.

clientId.description: The API credential's OAuth2 client ID

clientSecret.description:
The API credential's OAuth2 client secret

The client secret is returned only once and is not stored by StackPath. Please take care to save this response.

identityRotateUserCredentialSecretRespon.description: A response from a request to generate a new API client secret for a user

accountId.description: The ID of the StackPath account the policy is on

identitySetIAMPolicyResponse.description: A response from a request to set a StackPath account's policy

permissions.description: The set of permissions to test

accountId.description: The ID of the StackPath account the permissions were tested on

permissions.description: The set of permissions that the calling user does have on the account

identityTestIAMPermissionsResponse.description: A response from a request to test permissions on a StackPath account

success.description: Whether or not the request was successful

identityUpdateUserResponse.description: A response from a request to update a user's non-essential properties (phone number, etc)

email.description:
A user's email address

Email addresses are used as login names to the StackPath customer portal

accounts.description: The accounts that a user belongs to

identityUser.description:
A user account

Users can interact with the StackPath customer portal and API.

name.description:
An API credential's name

API credential names are typically associated with the user's application and operating environment

clientId.description: An API credential's OAuth2 client ID

createdAt.description: The date an API credential was created

updatedAt.description: The date an API credential was last updated

identityUserCredential.description:
User API credentials

API credentials are used to generate authorization tokens for use with the StackPath API. Generating API credentials creates a client ID and secret. Client secrets are exposed to the user only once on creation and are not stored at StackPath. Please record your client secret after generating API credentials.

StackPath recommends using one set of API credentials per application and operating environment.

identityUserStatus.description:
A user's status

- UNKNOWN: StackPath is unable to determine a user's status
 - ENABLED: A user is enabled and can log into their StackPath services
 - DISABLED: A user is disabled and cannot log into the StackPath customer portal or place API calls

totalCount.description: The total number of items in the dataset

hasPreviousPage.description: Whether or not a previous page of data exists

hasNextPage.description: Whether or not another page of data is available

startCursor.description: The cursor for the first item in the set of data returned

endCursor.description: The cursor for the last item in the set of data returned

paginationPageInfo.description:
Information about a paginated response

This is modeled after the GraphQL Relay spec to support both cursor based pagination and traditional offset based pagination.
